info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 10:37PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...SLIPPERY TRAVEL POSSIBLE EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... A period of snow will overspread interior Massachusetts between midnight and 2 AM. Precipitation will likely be in the form of mainly rain along the south coast, with a mix of snow and rain across northern CT into RI and southeast Massachusetts, then ending as a period of snow toward daybreak Thursday. The steadiest snow, perhaps moderate for a time will occur between 2 and 5 AM, then tapering off from west to east. Snow accumulations will be minor, a coating to an inch across northern Massachusetts, including the Greater Boston area and possibly southward into northern RI and CT. There is a low probability of a few locations receiving up to two inches. This may be sufficient for roads, especially untreated and secondary roads to become snow covered, mainly across the hilly terrain of northern Massachusetts, including the Mass Pike corridor and possibly the hilly terrain of northern CT and northwest RI. In addition, as the precipitation tapers off, temperatures will fall below freezing across this region, with any residual road moisture or slush freezing, possibly resulting in slippery travel for the morning commute.
